title: Authors and Citation
text: Kato , Molitor D (2023). lotusroot: Provides methods sparse GLM models. R package version 0.0.0.9002.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lotusroot: Provides methods for sparse GLM models},   author = {Akiru Kato and Daniel Molitor},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9002}, }

what: Provides methods for sparse GLM models
title: Provides methods for sparse GLM models
text: package implements parsnip engine dmolitor/glmSparse. goal glmSparse provide common methods coef, summary, predict, broom::tidy, etc. sparse GLMs implemented MatrixModels package. information particular implementation GLMs, see documentation MatrixModels::glm4. Additionally, glmSparse extends MatrixModels::glm4 allow user fit GLMs using formula syntax base R’s glm function well directly passing pre-formulated sparse model matrix response vector (sparse matrices defined Matrix package implementation).

what: Fitting sparse Generalized Linear Models — glmSparse
title: Fitting sparse Generalized Linear Models — glmSparse
text: glmSparse thin wrapper around MatrixModels::glm4. notable differences glmSparse always fits using sparse model matrix, provides alternate interface situations user wants directly provide sparse model matrix response variable instead using standard formula interface. details underlying implementation, see MatrixModels::glm4.

title: Fitting sparse Generalized Linear Models — glmSparse
code: glmSparse(   formula = NULL,   family = stats::gaussian,   data = NULL,   weights = NULL,   subset = NULL,   na.action = stats::na.fail,   start = NULL,   etastart = NULL,   mustart = NULL,   offset = NULL,   doFit = TRUE,   control = list(...),   model = TRUE,   contrasts = NULL,   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   drop.unused.levels = FALSE,   ... )

title: Fitting sparse Generalized Linear Models — glmSparse
text: formula object class formula, (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. family description error distribution link function used model. can character string naming family function, family function result call family function. (See family details family functions.) data optional data frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data frame) containing variables model. weights optional vector ‘prior weights’ used fitting process. NULL numeric vector. subset optional vector specifying subset observations used fitting process. na.action function indicates happen data contain NAs. default set na.action setting options, na.fail unset. ‘factory-fresh’ default na.omit. Another possible value NULL, action. Value na.exclude can useful. start Starting values parameters linear predictor. etastart Starting values parameters predictor . mustart Starting values parameters vector means. offset can used specify priori known component included linear predictor fitting. NULL numeric vector length equal number cases. One offset terms can included formula instead well, one specified, sum used. See model.offset. doFit Logical indicating model fitted (just returned unfitted). control list options fitting; currently passed unchanged (hidden) function IRLS(). model Currently ignored; back-compatibility glm. contrasts Currently ignored; back-compatibility glm. x Alternate interface modeling. already-constructed sparse model matrix (class 'dgCMatrix'). y Alternate interface modeling. numeric response vector. drop.unused.levels factors unused levels dropped? Defaults FALSE. ... Potentially arguments passed fitter functions; currently unused.
